review.reviewBody: Great gloves, warm yet breathable for uphills. I was able to wear these on a long backcountry touring trip every day despite a broad range of temps. They look good as well.

I've owned many pairs of gloves in search of the perfect thing for ski touring in the Rockies. The Mammut Astro Guide is my go-to glove for all-day touring missions in mid-winter.  They provide the ideal balance of warmth and breathability from temps of about 0 to -15 C. On warm days they get a bit sweaty but tend to dry out on the descent. 
That said, I always bring a backup fair of thin fleece gloves, extra gore-tex gloves for skiing or as a backup in case I need to do a bunch of unplanned digging, and sometimes another pair of mitts for colder days just in case. 
I typically buy XL gloves in other brands but often the fingers are too short. These Astros are size 11 and I'm very happy with the fit.
review.name: Quality and fit

review.reviewBody: Run small and they just don't keep my hands very warm at all, even when it is just moderately cold out.  The expert voice brain wants me to include things that worked and didn't work.  Uhhhh, OK, they didn't work for keeping my hands warm.  Expert voice also wants to know if these are better for a beginner or expert. Uhhh, neither?  Are experts better at having warm hands in inadequate gloves?  I have to keep typing and typing until the check box turns green.  Maybe just stating that they aren't warm and run small is enough, eh?
review.name: Runs small and not warm enough

review.reviewBody: I like all  Astro gloves , and as well Astro Guide Glove- great quality  gloves, warm and sizes 9 fine for me.
review.name: Astro Guide Glove

review.reviewBody: I love these gloves. I had originally bought a size 8. It was slightly large so I ended up ordering a size 7 also.  The 7 is perfect.  The quality of the leather is excellent and the hook and loop at the wrist for adjusting phenomenal.
review.name: Amazing quality and fit

review.reviewBody:
After use in the Rockies in the winter my hands were bloody cold but once I warmed them (with the gloves on) in my pockets while I hiked and broke a sweat and that warm core super heated my hands and these gloves OMG kept my hands for warm for hours through high winds and snow and scrambles through ice and rock. 
These gloves have grown on me but you gotta get your hands proper warm before they are super effective.
review.name: Stylish and warm when your core is warmed

review.reviewBody: I ordered the size recommended using the Mammut site.  The gloves that were delivered are so small I can barely put them on  They look like nice gloves but I will never know since I will not be able to wear them or exchange them for the correct size.
review.name: The sizing guide is way off

review.reviewBody: The build quality and comfort is top notch on these gloves! I have been using them for day hikes in Alaska as well as skate skiing as they have a nice grip on the poles. I normally prefer crab claw style gloves for downhill skiing and hiking but these have been great for 20 degree plus days. So far they have been fairly water repellent with snow even the wet sticky stuff. I also purchased the Mammut mit outer shell just in case things get too windy.
review.name: Great for winter hiking and skiing

review.reviewBody:
These gloves are very warm for their size, they have minimal bulk allowing you to retain some dexterity. I wear these gloves snowboarding and so far they have kept my hands dry and warm.

They fit true to size.

For my purpose, I would like to see them sold with a waterproof gore-tex membrane instead of the windstopper membrane but I understand snowboarding is not their intended use.
review.name: Great low-profile snowboarding glove

review.reviewBody: The best gloves I have owned to date. The fit is comfortable and tight enough to not lose the finger dexterity for a quick boulder or two. I use them for fly fishing in the winter as well and they are great for that.

name: Astro Guide Glove

review.reviewBody: Pants looked great, felt great, then ripped on the inside of leg from stepping up on a rock. They say they are meant for out door activities but they are not. Cheap and weak materials. Don’t buy.
review.name: Pants ripped after 1 month

review.reviewBody: Had the pants less than a month. First time out on a hike with family and they tore in half while climbing a tree stump with little kids.

review.reviewBody: I purchased these Chilli Lite Pants to try. I have some versions of the Kavu heavier "duck cotton" fabric that have endured a couple of decades, The fit for that Chilli Pants is great despite my weight and waistline having up to 2 inches of variation in that time, the variable and flexible fit is part of the reason I find these so comfortable. Currently 5"10", 180lb, 35-36"W I found the Large fits well for these Chilli Lite Pants. I love the roomy crotch area and casual but straight leg design. If I had a wish would be for a bit more positive lock on the Kavu integrated webbing belt. Would purchase again.
review.name: Comfy and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Relaxed workwear fit, half-elastic waist pant with logo shank button and zip fly, built-in burly belt with YKK center release buckle, half-moon silhouette pockets with right rear wallet stay, gusset, thick thread and double needle reinforced seams.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair.  I wash mine pretty often, and they are standing up to the test!
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody: These were just what I was looking for and really wanted to love them, the shorts were just a wee bit snugger than I usually like but the liner short was just too small. Will continue my search for a similar short for an aging but active rider!
review.name: Liner woes

review.reviewBody:
Been wearing the same pair since Nov 2019. The front zipper just broke, for seemingly no reason, which is disappointing for a product this expensive. The shorts are otherwise still in good condition.

The overshort is a bit too stretchy and sometimes catches on the front of the seat. 
The pockets are excellent for during and after rides - the thigh pocket easily fits a large cell phone. Plus you have enough space for snacks, sunglasses, whatever you need to stash. 

I am curvy in my hip and thighs, with a smaller waist. The chamois liner shorts fit really well, and the overshort fits well when I have the velcro tightened all the way. They don't gap in the back.
review.name: Pockets! Tad too stretchy, broken zipper

review.reviewBody: These are amazing. The padded liners can be removed and shorts warn like regular shorts. SO GREAT! They are stretchy enough so I can wear leggings under the padded shorts and regular shorts, yet their fitted when I'm just wearing the outer shorts. This is the only riding shorts and pads I will ever use. I've tried to destroy these and they last forever!
review.name: Best riding shorts EVER!!

review.reviewBody: These were just way too snug.  I liked the fee, strech an ddesign however, compared to several others, it was just too snug.  If they were road shrots, I would have kept them.  The pockets weren't in a great spot to put anything in as the fit was just too tight.  Perhaps a better short for someone with 10 less pounds or just not an athletic build as my thighs
review.name: Small

name: Navaeh Short + Essential Liner - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Most gloves seem to pad the left and right off the wrist. This puts the pad in the middle, protecting the carpal tunnel. And it works really well. No more numbness! 
Also easy to put on and take off. 
It's the first glove I can use on a road bike and a TT bike.
review.name: Unique palm pad placement works great

review.reviewBody: I have been using these gloves for years.  Padding is thin but somehow my hands are completely protected and never get numb even after 3+ hour rides.   I usually wear XXL.  Nobody on the Net had this size in red so I bought XL from Competitive Cyclist and hoped for the best.  These gloves fit like a...well, like a glove!  Hard to get on (and off) but once on the fit is amazing!  They like, disappear on your hand they fit so well and are so comfortable.  Very happy to find that the reduced size is really the best one for me.
review.name: A Size Smaller Still Worked Fine

review.reviewBody: First, I like that these are minimalist. I find that gel padding decreases circulation and comfort (contrary to the hype). These have one simple pad on the palm. That's the good. The bad is they run very small. I normally wear L, ordered XL just in case, and even they are tight. Also, there isn't a pull tab near the wrist to help put them on, and the wrist is very short (I'm okay that they don't have a Velcro strap for securing, I'm a minimalist). I am returning them and not trying the XXLs due to the short wrist without a pull tab.
review.name: Too snug

review.reviewBody: I loved the fit and comfort of these gloves - until they fell apart. The gel insert started shifting out of place pretty quickly and became increasingly difficult to push back in place. This shifting seemed to put pressure on the adhesive holding the fabric covering the gel in place leading to not long after the adhesive failing and the gel coming out. To Specialized credit, they sent another pair via warranty but same thing happened. I tried sewing the fabric back in place which helped but then the gel still kept shifting. So close to being a 4 or 5 star glove, but this issue just makes them a no-go for me.
review.name: Great fit and comfort but fell apart

review.reviewBody: The pad design  is pretty comfortable, but materials and finish leave much to be desired. TLDR the stitching is sloppy and the pad won't stay in place after 1 month.
review.name: Pad won't stay in place

review.reviewBody:
The difference this glove makes with the issue of numbness is night and day. Before I used these gloves my hands would begin to go numb within the first 20 minutes of a ride. I would be shaking my hands out constantly. These gloves make such a difference that even on long, 40+ mile rides my hands feel fine the entire time. they provide just enough cushion in the center of the palm to keep blood moving throughout the hand but you still feel connected to the bike. 

 I loved them so much, I bought a pair for my mom who has the same issue!
review.name: great for those battling numbness!
comment: Have they solved the gel pad issue?  After 2 rides the pad curled in on itself and created a taco. Ended up cutting it out to solve the issue.

name: Body Geometry Grail Glove

hasVariant.name: Ranger TCS Tubeless Tire - 29in
hasVariant.description: Buy the WTB Ranger TCS Tubeless Tire - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Ordered two 29 x 2.4s and one had the wobble. Tried multiple ways of correcting it. It seated as easy asany other tire, though they are little tough to mount on the rim without the use of levers. The only other tire I've struggled with is a Continental Krypotal DH/Super Soft.  I place it between that and a Krypotal Enduro/Soft for the amount of struggle mounting.

Out of the last dozen or so various tires I've bought, only had one other model that had the wobble (a Maxxis Assegai). 

As I'm still waiting on other parts and my frame to build up, I haven't had the chance to see how at least the one tire rides. 

This also meant I'm beyond the 30 day mark for returns.  I still reached out since it is a defective tire. A Gearhead responded to my email/request to return quickly with the offer to exchange for another of the same or pick something else and pay the difference if there was any.  That was nearly two weeks ago that he first responded. I responded the same day opting to get two of another tire and paying the difference. Since then I've followed up twice. No response.
review.name: 50/50 before getting a chance to ride

name: Ranger TCS Tubeless Tire - 29in

description: Buy the Carve Designs Mae Bikini Bottom - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mae Bikini Bottom - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Carve Designs Mae Bikini Bottom - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits well and covers the booty while still being stylish. Love the color! I'm very happy with this purchase. Carve Designs has become one of my "go to" online stores. I always get compliments and asked "where'd you get that?" I suggest you give them a try!
review.name: Love these bottoms!

review.reviewBody: The waist band is snug but the bottom is loose, creating a partial wedgie. Doesn't become a thong but it also doesn't stay put. This is also only high rise if you have a shorter torso or you really pull up on it, which then leads to a lot more crotch showing then I'm comfortable with. This will probably be for lounging only. The size recommendation was a S and sizing chart said XS. I went with XS and am glad I did. I'm 5'5", 126 lbs, 32A/26/35.5, with torso and legs of equal length. I have wide shoulders/lats and a decent booty.
review.name: Strange fit

review.reviewBody: These bottoms are very flattering on my curvy body! Deducting one star because they run a little large - I typically order L in Carve bottoms but I wish I had ordered a M for the Mae. Love the cheeky cut
review.name: Recommended

review.reviewBody: Love the crossover front. Cheeky in the back. Material is soft and comfortable
review.name: Flattering

review.reviewBody: For those who want high waist without feeling like you’re in Granny panties- this is it! I feel secure without feeling bound in, nothing pinches or rides up. The front overlap detail and high cut legs are feminine and flattering. Please keep making this style!!!
review.name: Perfectly cut

review.reviewBody: My favorite print so far! High rise and cheeky - flattering for us moms too ;)
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Obsessed with everything about this swimsuit! I had been struggling to find f a bikini I felt confident and pretty in after having a baby but this suit put ab instant smile on my face. It has great coverage and support for moms who are always on the move!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's very comfortable and flattering. I haven't tested it in the water yet so not sure how it will hold up.
review.name: Love the fit and feel

review.reviewBody: I can't decide on these. I like them but not sure how flattering they are. good coverage in the back. High cut on the sides.
review.name: I can't decide on these.

review.reviewBody: I have an athletic build, straight through my waist to hips, and a pretty short torso. I so badly want high waisted swim bottoms to fit me, but they just do not. These bottoms are the perfect in between! Not a low rise, and not too high. They look so flattering! I purchased these with the Sanitas top. So excited to get to wear these!
review.name: Favorite bottoms ever!

name: Mae Bikini Bottom - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Whenever working on components that you dont want to keep working on constantly.
Use factory parts and oils.  The engineering that was used in these designs are tried, trued tested and proved. Why change?
review.name: ALWAYS FACTORY

review.reviewBody: Rebuilt my fork seals and decided to go with 5w and it made a great difference in the dampening on the front suspension for me.
review.name: Great oil to have for forks

review.reviewBody: I've been using motorex fork oil for several years now. It has very good longevity with very little break down.
review.name: Great Fork Oil

review.reviewBody:
4w is now available in single liter containers (newer ktm forks). 4w Motorex is actually closer to Motorex 2.5w than to 5w viscosity-wise.
http://www.motorexoil.com.au/wp-dev/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/MOTOREX-Fork-Oil-Viscosity-Mix.pdf
review.name: FYI

review.reviewBody: Great product. I will be using it again next time my forks need servicing.
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: I consider this to be quality oil. I needed 10W for my Moto Guzzi and I'm happy with the performance of the product. Motosport is a good vendor, reasonable pricing, quick shipping and everything was done right.
review.name: It works well

review.reviewBody: Been running this brand since 2002. Been very happy and I don't think I will ever try something else.
review.name: It's#1 all I use.

review.reviewBody: 2016 KTM 250 XC-W specs call for 4wt fork oil! Who makes that--Motorex but only available by the gallon at about $140.00 or more! So what the heck--I settled for 5wt that is still a bit over priced but not like the 4wt oil! I doubt I will notice a difference between the oil viscosities.
review.name: Good oil but not what is specified

review.reviewBody: This oil is the best protection for your forks, last long.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Best fork oil on the market
review.name: Motorex Fork Oil

name: Racing Fork Oil

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great packing cubes that really work with good zippers!
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was very skeptical at first about the benefit I would get from these, but I love them. They help me get more stuff in my bag and keep things organized. I don't always need them but when I have a lot of stuff and am trying to only carry on, these are a life saver.
review.name: Make the most out of your packing experience

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my boyfriend and then got a set for myself on top of buying a 2nd Method suitcase with it. I have bought packing cubes before not the best quality... but these are "the best" very durable fabric and it holds a lot of clothes good color choices
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The compression feature is very helpful-you can keep the cubes small when the extra space isn't needed, and compress any clothing items to minimize the occupied volume.
review.name: Very effective for travel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent packing cubes that save a bunch of space and keeps your items organized!
review.name: Great space savers!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best compression packs! They are easier to compress than the Eagle Creeks. I can pack one small carry on per person using these compression pack. My family can travel with less bags and travel more efficiently and easily. These are a MUST!
review.name: These are a MUST!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These really help get clothing down to size for packing the travel bag and the carry on. Love them.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great sizes! Each holds a lot and compacts down to very packable size. The see through is a nice feature, so you can see what is each cube.
review.name: Great sizes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far i had 2 sets of cubes. It makes my packing easy.
review.name: Useful

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have used other packing cubes in the past and they were fine. However I took a chance with these Nomatic Compression Packing Cubes, and have been very happy with the results. The quality of the zippers, outer material and the compression scale is great. Fit and work well with my Nomatic Luggage. Highly recommended.
review.name: Next Level Packing Cubes

review.reviewBody: Fits great and is so soft and warm. Blocks wind well and love the giant pocket for my hands
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: This is a great fleece. It’s comfy, warm and looks good! Not at all bulky! The pockets are well thought out. Went and bought it white I liked it so much!
review.name: Awesome purchase!

review.reviewBody: I read reviews saying to size down so I stuck to my normal size, medium, and it fit as shown on the mods but I exchanged it for a large for a more comfortable fit to move around in. I wouldn't pay full price for this as it is just your basic fleece, nothing too special. But I really like the style and fleece hoodies are hard to come by.
review.name: A good basic

review.reviewBody: I love this hoodie. I wear it everywhere. It is the perfect weight for the Pacific Northwest. I am 5'2" and 140 pounds and the small fits me perfectly.
review.name: Super cozy

review.reviewBody: Have been enjoying this jacket. It is very warm, soft and comfortable Purchased in black and I like it Sized down. I am often in between small and medium. Medium was a bit too big. I like the fit of the small better
review.name: Warm and nice

review.reviewBody: Love this fleece. Very flattering and nice and warm but not too bulky. I will live in this piece on my trip to Alaska! Cant wait! Also nice that it has a pocket to stash items or keep your hands warm.
review.name: Stylish comfy warmth!!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this hoodie. It keeps me warm and I also love the look of it. I've already received a ton of compliments and interest in where I got it. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great pullover fleece

review.reviewBody: Perfect. I love the inner lining. This makes it super warm and cozy!
review.name: So cozy!

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm, keeps me cozy, keeps it casual while looking good. Would get 3 more of these if I could reason it! Would recommend for work, the trail, or the campsite. Don't miss out on one of OR's nicer fleece hoody options!
review.name: Comfort that comes with good looks

review.reviewBody: This is not only a cozy top, it is so cute. I get tons of compliments when I wear it. The white with turquoise and orange accents is stylish and makes one forget how cold it is out. Size medium for a size 10 is perfect. Love the fit and the styling of this winter top.
review.name: Warm right up

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loving this pack. Excellent fit. I hardly noticed I was wearing it. Plenty of of space for action camera accessories in main compartment.
review.name: Loving this pack. Excellent fit.

review.reviewBody: Coming from a waist hydration pack, I needed more room for tubes and tools as I changed to a mullet wheel setup on a Levo SL which has no tool storage. The Raptor 10L is larger than I expected and has a lot of room for everything I carry. The waist and chest straps hold the pack securely to my body unlike old CamelBaks that would flop around while descending. The water bladder is easy to fill and fast to install in the pack and has a drink tube holder that snaps to the chest strap with a magnet. There is room for a light jacket to store as well.
review.name: Raptor 10L is working well for my needs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Husband loves the pack. He picked, I buy since it was his birthday present. I do not trust myself to choose the backpack I think he will likes.
review.name: Husband loves the pack. He

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the bag, but not for Mountain Biking. I wish there was still a 6L version. The new 10L version is just too big for a MTB bag.
review.name: I like the bag, but

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was going on a multi day bike packing trip and needed a 2.5L Hydration Pack that could also carry a bunch of stuff comfortably. I did some research and this bag was exceptionally well reviewed so I figured I'd try it. The bag lives up to all the hype and absolutely delivered! So happy with it, absolutely worth the money. Very comfortable even after 12 hour days and 5 days in a row!
review.name: I was going on a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like that you put the tool pouch on the bottom to lower the weight. But I still like a Bigger stretch pouch on the back for extra jacket, gears n beers etc
review.name: I like that you put

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Raptor 10 for several months as a hunting backpack and also while training my dog in the woods. I have used it a few times every week for months now and it has performed excellently. I have a small collapsible water bowl for my dog that clips on the bag and is so handy when we are on long runs in the woods and open fields. It holds plenty of water for both of us during our outings. The bag carries a couple of dummy birds, gloves and hat. And the waist band carries plenty of treats. I haven't used all the space in this bag and is still room which I'll use for shotgun shells during hunting season. This bag fits perfectly in the center of my back and is small enough where it doesn't interfere when having to go over and under downed trees and through heavy brush or crossing small streams. It doesn't interfere when shouldering a rifle. It's not even showing any signs of wear. This has been one of my better buys in sporting equipment. Get it!
review.name: Raptor 10 is a great compact backpack

review.reviewBody:
The size and capacity are perfect. I bought this after returning a Talon 11 because it was too big. The Raptor 10 has half the capacity of the Talon. The capacity measurements are a joke. 
My one problem with the Raptor is there is no side water bottle pocket. There is not a good way to have bear spray readily accessible.
review.name: Needs a side pocket.

name: Raptor 10L Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought this totepack some time ago and I’m in love! I’ve always used the regular kånken backpack, but then I decided to switch to this one! It’s SUPER practical and I use it everyday for school or going out with my friends. My IPad, books and notebooks fit very well, never had a situation, where something would not fit in inside. I got it in black, as it matches most of my clothes. Go ahead and get one :) greetings from Germany!
review.name: In LOVE

review.reviewBody: for the most part these are great pants, I wish they had the G1000 on the butt. I got a small tear on the inside of lower leg from catching a crampon on first use but that's more my fault. They were warm with no under layer on a fall alpine climb, def recommend.
review.name: over all a good cold weather pant

review.reviewBody: Perfect for college! Great space to keep your things organized
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Love, LOVE, LOVE! I’m so in love with my vibrant yellow bag. One of the many reasons I purchased this bag was because of the versatility. I’ve been looking for something to carry my laptop and to also use as a pocket book; this bag is made to perfection to accommodate my needs.
review.name: Absolutely perfect!

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack 3 weeks ago for my international business trip. I used it carrying my 15-inches MacBook Pro during the week to the office and for traveling/sightseeing on weekends. This bag is perfect for both settings! It’s so lightweight which I appreciate the most as I’m a smaller sized girl. It’s also water resistant which was perfect for traveling. If I have to say one thing I don’t like, the side pocket for my water bottle was a bit tight, but I have a slightly wider tumbler.
review.name: Perfect for both business casual and traveling

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the fact that I can choose to wear this as a backpack or a tote bag. As a mom who carries multiple bags out the house everyday, the option to wear this as a tote bag is a lifesaver. The size of the bag is perfect in my opinion. I use the back sleeve pocket for my iPad Air instead of having the cushion in there. I can fit my 24oz Owala bottle inside WITH zipping the backpack. Along with all of my other belongings. The length of the straps as a backpack are pretty much what I expected them to be (I have a Kanken mini backpack). There is no room for adjustment but they fit me just right when putting it on as a backpack. Of course this will vary person to person. I highly recommend this bag to anyone who constantly switches from a tote bag to a backpack. Now you can have both in one!
review.name: Tote bag or backpack? Of course I had to buy one.

review.reviewBody: I love, love, love this bag. It is what it says it is. Light weight tote that can carry a lot of stuff. Not a lot of pockets, but organized enough that it doesn’t become a mess. Converts into a low profile pack, great for walks, concerts, short hikes. Fabric holds up well and is weather resistant. I have found this to be my go-to. The straps will be uncomfortable with a lot of weight; but like the description says…. It’s a tote. I love the quality and the versatility!
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: I love the color and it fit my laptop along with additional tech. My big drink cups don't quite fit perfectly in the sides and I have yet to test the backpack straps, but I'm very happy with my purchase thus far.
review.name: Happy

review.reviewBody: I got this because it could be used as a tote or backpack. I was worried it would sit too low on my back when used as a backpack, but it’s the perfect position. Fits my small computer and the design is simple. Perfect.
review.name: Great versatile travel bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag after many years of using the classic kanken as a nappy bag, ready to move on to a bag I could use as a tote now that I have less to carry around every day. This bag has been more than perfect, everyday it is my tote/laptop bag, but it also comes on adventures with my family hiking and walking as a backpack carrying everyone’s snacks. I also bought the shoulder straps, chest clip, and two bottle pockets which I was worried would be overkill but when using as a backpack all day, those items have really helped and expanded the carrying capacity! Doesn’t matter that you can’t clip the shouldn’t pads to the bag itself, one you have them in a comfy spot they don’t move! I got a frost green bag which is darker in real life than in the pics, I also got the pink bottle pockets, yellow shoulder pads and rainbow chest clip, love the mix and match look with all the colours!
review.name: Great tote and great backpack!

name: Kanken Totepack

description: Buy the Maxxis Aggressor Wide Trail EXO/TR 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aggressor Wide Trail EXO/TR 29in Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Maxxis Aggressor Wide Trail EXO/TR 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I am running this tire on 3 bikes.  
I started using it on my enduro as a heavier casing allowes for a beating. 
I took my endure on some of my local trails and really enjoyed the hookup over my lighter tire setups - so I ended up switching over my Ripley and Hardtail to the same tire combo.  
Combined with a Assagai front tire, I have no complaints at all.  The weight is expected with this type of tire, but the traction offered outweighs the downside.
review.name: Best rear tire for traction in my area

review.reviewBody:
After running the DHR II in the rear for ages, and a lack of inventory in them this year, I decided to run the Aggressor in the rear at the start of this season. I am super impressed with this tire! 

The grip is amazing and the transition is seamless. When descending this tire rides the line perfectly of being grippy but allowing you to comfortably push beyond that grip to get a little slide (or roost) if you want. Rolling resistance vs the DHR II is noticeably lower, too. On straights while descending I have noticed the bike moving faster without any effort on my part.

I went 4/5 stars for a couple of reasons. First and foremost, without the EXO+ the durability is not as good. I punctured this tire twice in as many days. The second being a sidewall hit that did not seal. Thank you Cush Core for letting me finish my ride. Second reason the grip in less than hardpack conditions isn't as good as the DHR II. Here in Utah we get deep moon dust by mid-season and this thing has not handled the moon dust that well. Going to swap this out for a Dissector or go back to the DHR II now that trails are getting blown out. 

Overall- this is an amazing tire for hardpack to slightly loose conditions. This will be my tire of choice for early season riding from here on out.
review.name: Great Rear Tire

review.reviewBody:
Bought this to replace the same tire on my Ibis Ripmo. Good traction in most conditions, not too much rolling resistance. And durable, it gets a lot of abuse between the granite rocks and oak roots here in New England. Not very grippy on wet roots, but haven't found a tire that is.
Looked at other options when I needed a replacement but this hits the sweet spot for me: price, weight, and traction.
Using on the rear, works great for me.
review.name: Aggressor 29

review.reviewBody: I take med/large in gloves. I took my measurements, checked the size chart, and bought the medium. I couldn't even get them on my hand, so I returned them and bought the large,  same problem. Aside from the misleading size chart, the design lacks any elastic at the cuff. This means that not only will it be hard to get them on, the cuff will never fit snug, since it has to be at least as large as the circumference around the knuckles. Hands are not built like that. Sorry, TNF, I trusted you, and you let me down.
review.name: Flawed Design, Faulty Size Chart

review.reviewBody: I'm right now at 5 Celsius and my hands are freezing. These gloves are like wearing nothing. Don't buy it
review.name: Not worth

review.reviewBody: These are my second pair. First pair had for 3 years and these are updated and better. Warm, windproof, and pocketable. Works great with my mobile. A definite buy for everyday winter gloves. I would switch to a warmer glove when temp go below ~35 F.
review.name: Perfect everyday winter gloves

review.reviewBody: Love this purchase. These gloves are perfect for cold weather !
review.name: These gloves are warm and great to use with my phone

review.reviewBody: Use these for work and they do a great job at keeping my hands, warm and dry!
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: These gloves have a great flex and keep my hands warm.
review.name: Warm and flexible

review.reviewBody: Can't wait for it to get cold to wear these stylish
review.name: Be prepared for anything

review.reviewBody: Good gloves. Very warm, touchscreen compatibility works well.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: High Quality. Waterproof. Warm. Light. Mobility. Sturdy. Stylish.
review.name: Excellent Gloves

review.reviewBody: I live above the Arctic Circle in Western Alaska and need the best in cold weather gear, these are great gloves. Excellent design, durable and dependable. I would like to see North Face design an extreme version of their awesome gloves.
review.name: Built for real world extremes.

name: Apex Insulated Etip Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Soft, comfy, warm, and good looking later top! This is the perfect layer whether going outside on active pursuits - perfect layer - or for throwing on in a cooler office in the winter. Always nice when items look good and are functional at the same time.
review.name: Perfect blend of function and fashion

review.reviewBody: Beautiful and comfy girded half zip. Love the kangaroo pocket and hood!
review.name: Amazing mid layer!

review.reviewBody: fits great, allows ease of movement, comfortable, warm and breathable.  I love the length and the half zip is big enough to put on over a hat or helmet.
review.name: warm and breathable

review.reviewBody: I bought one about a year ago and it's been on many adventures with me. It's great of hiking, rock climbing, just hanging out, etc. In fact, this fleece was my #1 favorite piece of gear or clothing I brought with me on an Appalachian Trail thru-hike. It was so so comfy, breathable for hiking in cooler temperatures, works as a great mid layer under a puffy, and didn't hold onto b.o. very much. Plus it's super cute, and we all know that's the most important thing when you're being a dirt bag. The half zip is great for people like me who don't like the feeling of a cowl neck, but still like the ability to zip the neck and hood up in cooler temps or high winds. 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: I want 20 of them.

name: Summit Grid 1/2-Zip Pullover - Women's

review.reviewBody: Patagonia makes excellent products but I ordered this from Backcountry on November 20, 2024. Not only have I not received the waders I haven’t received any status at all. If you can’t fill the order why take the order?
review.name: Back ordered and no communication

review.reviewBody: The only waders I've ever seen with legitimate sex appeal. 10/10
review.name: Like lingerie for the river.

review.reviewBody: Love these waders! I’m not Sally O?Malley, but I?m 50 years old!  These waders let me kick stretch and kick.  (See SNL) seriously, The Zipper is golden.  So much easier to get into especially if you are wearing a lot of layers for winter steelheading etc.  I couldn?t layer up enough and get into my other waders - never mind having to relieve yourself along the stream.   The zipper makes it all possible.  They are cut closer too so you don?t have a lot of material catching brush as you hike. *Tips: combine these with a light long underwear and Nano puff pants and they are warm in winter! Also, try to get the stocking foot to your size -check out Patagonia’s website for the extended sizes to know which to order.  Sign up for the emails from Backcountry and get 15% off!  You be glad you did.
review.name: Greatest Waders Ever

name: Swiftcurrent Expedition Zip-front Waders - Men's

review.reviewBody: There is a trick to using these. When assembling your alpine draw, always pass the rope-end biner through the wall-end biner and clip the strand. Then lengthening will be quick every time. Grab the spine, tilt back, open the gate, and tilt down. But if you assemble it in the opposite way, it will get tangled and become a process to lengthen half the time. Fantastic product though. So nice to see that Blue Ice is putting out best in class products at mid pack prices. Might be my new fav gear company. Hope they eat Arc'teryx's lunch soon.
review.name: Better than dyneema slings

name: Alpine Runner

review.reviewBody: My daughter said that this is the most comfortable backpack that she's ever had. Her back isn't hurting carrying it. It fits all of her school supplies.

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my younger brother as a birthday gift, and he LOVES it. It is the perfect size for him as a 10 year old, and it is holding up well. It is still big enough to hold all of his school supplies + some more. The price point for this bag is also great. Wound recommend this bag!!
review.name: My brother loves it

name: Court Jester 25L Backpack - Kids'

hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Griddle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace the grill on the RoadTrip portable propane stove that I recently purchased, giving e capability to do eggs, pancakes, etc. I bought the RoadTrip after inquiring if it was a “low pressure” device, which my travel trailer required to operate from its propane system. Coleman said it was “low pressure”, but with its additional regulator it does not work from my travel trailer’s propane system. It’s a good product, but does not meet my original requirement.
review.name: Great Product, But….

review.reviewBody: While these fit the grill great my only major complaint is that they did not come with any care, seasoning, or cleaning instructions.  My husband made French toast and slightly burned it, so I guess that'll take getting used to, as to how to set the temp on the grill. Even though there was some burned food on them they did clean fairly easy with soap, water and a bit of elbow grease.
review.name: To Swap or Not

review.reviewBody: Impressed with this item.  Ordered it and happy to have it arrive quickly as described.  The surface is easy to work on.  Love the versatility of having the grill on one side and this griddle on the other side... although if the group is large.... the only thing better would be to have 2 of the griddles to mass produce pancakes!  LOVE this item!
review.name: Road Trip Swagtop Cast Iron Griddle

review.reviewBody: Great for all griddle top needs! Eggs, Bacon, Bread, Veggies. I love this thing and it makes my roadtrip xcursion much more versitile!
review.name: A Must Have For Cooking Options!

review.reviewBody: This cast iron cook top is great! Holds heat well and cooks evenly.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and finish. Just what I was looking for.
review.name: just right

review.reviewBody: Flat-top grilling without a flat-top!  Love the versatility of grilling on a flat-top on occasion.
review.name: Love the versatility of adding a flat-top surface!

review.reviewBody:
Hurricane? Can't wait to cook breakfast
This should work perfectly for eggs and bacon.
review.name: Just what I need.

review.reviewBody: While it is very lightweight,  the Coleman grill dies a great job with its griddle( sold separately) it does not stick, and it is very easy to clean. We love it!
review.name: Love our Coleman Grill

review.reviewBody: Works really good and easy to clean. Great to use for veggies .
review.name: Love it

name: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Griddle

review.reviewBody: These glove were wayyyyyyy too small. I usually wear a large in women’s gloves and was surprised that after measuring my hand, the size guide recommended a medium so that is what I ordered. When they arrived I could barely get my hands in the gloves. They seem like nice gloves but I am disappointed that the sizing guide is so incorrect. I probably would need an x-large, not a medium. :(
review.name: Size guide is inaccurate

review.reviewBody: I love these gloves quality wise. They are sturdy and well made, and keep me protected. I ordered the Women's size Large, and they just feel the tiniest bit snug. I loved the color though, so I didn't want to go with the men's sizing.
review.name: Good Quality, Fits Small

review.reviewBody: Great gloves but they run very small. I’d recommend sizing up!
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: Love these belay gloves, I bought a new pair to replace my old ones that were a men's xs. The women's sizes do run small though. My measurements matched the small but they are tight. Hoping they break in a bit and loosen up.
review.name: Run small

review.reviewBody: I have been buying this same glove for years in the xs and it always fit perfectly. I couldn’t even get these on my hand. They are more like a children’s xs and may fit a 6 yr old girl.
review.name: Manufacturing defect. EXTREMELY small

review.reviewBody:
Pros: really like the padding location on these gloves (knuckles and palms), decent color options, pull tabs to take off. 

Cons: sizing! I recommend sizing up. From the top of my finger to base of my palm puts me directly in the XS range (per measurement guide on BD’s site) BUT my palm takes the majority of that measurement (shorter fingers). It would have been a better fit to do a small. I’d recommend for BD to size by palm (base of palm to base of middle finger) for more accurate sizing for their half finger gloves. 

Overall: BD does make a good product! Good for the craig and good for via ferratas. As always, try and go somewhere to try on the product(s) you want.
review.name: Gets the job done

review.reviewBody: I use these gloves for rappelling and I absolutely love them. They are perfect because you can still be dexterous but your hands are totally protected when you are descending. The size I bought fits great and I just bought a backup pair as well.
review.name: Awesome Gloves

review.reviewBody: I've worn my friends' crag half-finger gloves and they're awesome, super durable but also comfortable. I should've checked what size those were before ordering my own because I ordered way too small by accident and will have to exchange!
review.name: Great gloves but too small

review.reviewBody: The gloves were fine, but the were extremely tight. I had used the sizing chart, but it is very vague. I ordered an extra small, but I had to return them as they were much too small.
review.name: Good product, but hard to decide size.

review.reviewBody: I wear small/XS BD gloves for everything else. Got these in small and couldn’t even get them over a single finger.
review.name: Gloves for ants?

name: Crag Half-Finger Glove - Women's

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Only good thing I have to say about them is that they easy to slip on. They definitely not waterproof, my socks by my toes got wet just from walking in wet grass.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Thank you for writing, we are sorry for the inconvenience. We are here to help, and have emailed you so that we can amend the issue. Thank you for leaving this feedback so we can continue to improve our products.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Takes a fair bit to break in but worked out in the long run. Wide fit which is really hard to find. My only grip is the eyelits at the top stick out far too much. Women have more narrow gates then men, and if you are on a narrow path, especially coming down a mountain, these two inside top eyelits will catch each other. I nearly fell so many times. I had used them already so unable to return, so I got a hammer out and whacked them a few times to make them go more in. They are really tough so they only moved a bit but it seems enough to stop me tripping as much. Deducted one star for this. Salomon - please fix this!
review.name: Great wide boot

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: At first I was worried how bad it would hurt. This pair of shoes break in with just wearing once for a walk. It doesn’t hurt the feet afterwards
review.name: Doesn’t hurt your feet
comment: Hello, thank you for leaving this comment. We are glad to know that you liked our shoes.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been buying versions of this shoe for at least 10 years. It used to be made in a more durable and better looking leather version. Now they only make the cheaper synthetic version. Looking for a new brand of shoe now..
review.name: Used to be the best hiking shoe..
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: In love with everything about these shoes. So so glad I invested in them!
review.name: A truly amazing purchase!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fairly lightweight boot with good grip on a variety of terrains. I’ve used for both day hikes and longer back country trips with no complaints. Minimal break-in required. Only downside is the lack of arch support, but nothing a good pair of insoles can’t fix!
review.name: Lightweight, durable, versatile

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like these shoes but the sides keep digging into my ankles and the areas where there are creases hits my toes even w it h thick wool socks.
review.name: It’s light but painful

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these boots to day hike. Very comfortable out of the box and no blisters. Lower ankle coverage than our other Salomon hiking boots but very pleased. Has a very aggressive tread and very comfortable.
review.name: Very pleased

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've had multiple pairs of these shoes and definitely put them through the wringer with my job. They've been extremely comfortable from day one and have hardly any break-in time. These don't last super long for me but I use them mainly as work shoes. These will last me anywhere between 6-8 months on the job through rigorous hosing, bleach, and a whole bunch of other chemicals so they definitely get their share of work. I switched to a different pair the last time I bought from here just to try something different but these will always be my go-to.
review.name: Comfortable and durable

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: 4th pair of Salomon over past ten years.. very pleased with them.. light weight, comfortable ( though not over cushioned for a day walking on tarmac) . Can’t comment on durability as only a month old but if they last like previous pairs, will be extremely happy
review.name: Excellent

name: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is so cute, warm and fits perfectly around my baby’s head so it keeps her ears nice and warm!! There’s room for me to put her warm booties on in the cuffed pant leg (she’s not walking yet) to keep her feet nice and warm! Plenty of room to layer and trap heat! Also isn’t super fluffy so can be worn in the car seat on chilly morning rides! She is 8 months old but wearing mostly 12 month clothes (she’s a 98th percentile kinda gal)  and the measurements provided were spot on to have a nice roomy fit.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Baltoro 75L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Took it on the Rae Lakes Loop in Kings Canyon for 4 nights and 5 days. It carried the weight comfortably. It was large enough to fit my food, clothes, and gear.
My son bought one, too. So three of us have this pack.
review.name: Comfortable and large

review.reviewBody: Just did a 4 day 3 night trip in the Trinity Alps; lots of rain and would have appreciated a rain cover but the pack didn’t let any water in and it was incredibly easy to carry my 42 lb load in rough terrain.  So many features and the comfort was tops.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Love this cushy pack

review.reviewBody: I've been using this pack for a year now and I love it. It has so many great features but my favorite is the fact that I can access my main pack from zippers on the outside. No more fear that I've buried something I might need to access before getting to camp. Now I can easily access those items from the outside zippers. Also love the 3 pocket brain, dual outside pockets, mesh pocket and bottle holster.
review.name: Love the Front U-Zip access to main body of pack

review.reviewBody: This is the best bag you can buy right now. The bag does extremely well with packing. I over pack pretty consistently and this bag has a place for everything. I did a short 6 mile summit and forgot to bring a day pack, I left out my tent and sleeping bag, kept everything else and had no issues. The comfortably is 10/10. I went on 4 day trip tracking about 7-8 each day and nothing was sore or felt noticeable different after the trip. Great bag, highly recommend.
review.name: Amazing Bag

review.reviewBody: Comfortable pack that distributes the weight well on trail. Tried on different packs but this one fit my frame the best. Recommend this pack.

For reference I am 6'1 200lb. This pack fits me perfectly. Even when packed to the gills, I don't notice the weight nearly as much as I have with other packs. The only negative is that it doesn't come with a rain cover.
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody: A full featured, luxury pack with a comfortable, padded hip belt, adjustable torso length, and a convenient number of external pockets through the pack to organize gear.
review.name: Luxury Pack

review.reviewBody: This is actually my third Gregory pack and after trying many on, they are always my go to for comfort, stability and balance
review.name: Wonderful!

review.reviewBody: Just bought my second Gregory Baltoro pack.  My previous one has been amazing. Top quality design and construction, lasting nearly 15 years and hundreds of miles. Truth is, it’s still usable. I’m just updating to get the latest technology.  I fully expect this version of the Gregory Baltoro to last as long and be as or more comfortable the my previous.
review.name: Expecting a Repeat of Great Things

review.reviewBody: Awesome bag , lots of room, super comfortable pack even when loaded to full capacity! Love this bag

name: Baltoro 75L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been looking for an alternative to gym shoes, for those cold days, when there's no snow on the ground.  I thought I hit the jackpot when I saw these.  I decided to order the velvet tan/sanguine for fun and the black to be practical.  I normaly wear a 11.5M, so I figured I'd better order the 12M.  Right out of the box, the tan/sanguine color was just stunning.  But, as soon as I put these boots on my feet, I was like, "What the heck!?!?!"  These boots were so tight I had to double check the box and tongue, to make sure I got size 12.  I'm not sure in what universe this is a 12M, but they aren't in mine.  Depending on what size you wear, I'd caution against ordering these, unless you can go up at least 1.5 sizes.  Sadly, these are going back.
review.name: Beautiful boot, but runs small
comment: Hello Stu, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our ONA AVE™ Alpine Women's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute but the insole is already coming out after only wearing for a few hours. Very disappointed in the quality of these since I have been a diehard Sorel wearer but the quality of these is lacking.
review.name: Poor Quality
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots for winter! The perfect upgrade for the ug style chunky slip on with the warmth and waterproof features of Sorel. So much more practical and fashionable!
review.name: Perfect chunky warm waterproof winter boot!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Worst quality and terrible sizing. I ordered half a size up the first time I ordered these and they were normal but fit too small. So I reordered a full size up and both boots were deformed. The left boot has something poking out of the top on the inside that immediately hurt my foot as I tried it on. The right boot crushed my foot and was even smaller than the first size I purchased. They also had scuffs and loose threads. How in the world are these boots getting out into the world with no quality control? I'm so incredibly disappointed.
review.name: Just No
comment: Hello angie26, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our ONA AVE™ Alpine Women's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Really love these boots but i think they come up a bit small , maybe go half a size bigger ?
review.name: Loveky cosy boots

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super cute and warm and waterproof but they def run small- i would recommend going up a minimum of a half sixe

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots they are so cute! I did have to re-order twice though! I usually wear an 8 and they were too small near the toe, so I re-ordered an 8.5. Unfortunately they were still a little too snug so I ended up sending them back for a 9. They are amazing shoes though, so cute and very comfy. I've worn them two days in a row all day and they felt great and I got a lot of compliments
review.name: Love but ran a little small

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm still shocked influenster was able to send these out! I can't wait for winter. These fit great, amazing quality and seem like they'll be warm and keep my feet dry during the Midwest cold and snow.  I am very happy to have got a pair of sorel boots!
review.name: They are great!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoes overall were great and durable, the waterproofing made the shoes amazing. The fit was also great, I love how they feel, super comfortable and have great traction.
review.name: Amazing boots

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sorel Ona Ave. Waterproof Boots 

I received the Sorel Ona Ave. Waterproof Boots from #Sorel and #influenster in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. 

The first thing I would like to tell you is that I felt that they ran a bit small, because I got the size I would normally have gotten if I were to buy boots, and they were tight. I was able to get them on, but not to comfortably move around with them on. If they would have actually fit, they would have been a dream. (Yes, I made contact about this issue)
Also, when I received the claim, there were only full sizes, so I picked what I would normally get in shoes that only have full sizes. 🤷🏼‍♀️

Besides that, I have to say that I found them to be made quite nicely. They feel very sturdy, even with how light they are. They have nice metal  eye rings so you don't have to worry about them breaking while you are walking, hiking, or climbing. They have a good strong shoestring. They have a loop for pulling them on, which is awesome for getting them on quickly. They have a really nice soft inside, and the entrance to the boot is a faux fur.. The top ankle part, is not too low, but not so high that it goes up on your calf, so that it is nice and comfortable and you don't have to feel it pushing in on the back of your leg during the day when walking, or hiking. They do look nice with jeans. I like the fact that they are all black, so they will go with most any color you try to wear that day. They felt very warm, so I don't believe that there would be any problem with your feet getting cold. I love the fact that they are waterproof, and insulated because I like to go hiking, and sometimes you have to cross little streams, which are very cold in the mountains. These boots have really nice tread on them, and from the feel of the soles they feel like they would last for a good long time, especially with how well the boots are made. The inner sole is a soft but strong foam that reminds me of a heavy memory foam. 
I would definitely recommend these boots, because I would love to be able to actually wear them around myself because they are a fantastically made boot with a dreamy interior, but alas, I will not be able to. At some point I will try to buy my own pair that will fit me.
review.name: They seemed to run small.

name: Ona Ave Alpine Suede Synthetic WP Boot - Women's

Bought for bad weather winter riding - gravel and mtb. 
On sizing - need to order a size up. I’m a 46 in specialized, needed a 47 in these Sidi. Tried a 46 and too tight. 47 is a tad large - but for this application works great.
Fit and comfort is exceptional, incredibly warm on the coldest of days. Perform perfectly in light rain and all the mtb mud. 
Where they lose stars is medium to heavy rain. The ankle cuff is relatively wide open, rain or tire splatter spraying on your legs just runs straight into the shoes. On a particularly rainy ride my feet almost froze as the shoes filled with spray. Only option is to use booties/covers and create a tighter seal between pants and ankle.. which IMO is pretty lame - I thought whole idea of these was to avoid booties.. 

Basically - 5 stars for cold and mild wet rides, puddles and all that. 2 stars for riding in rain or very wet riding without fenders.
review.name: Almost perfect - darn good

name: Hiemx Cycling Boot

description: Buy the Bike Yoke Squeezy online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Squeezy
hasVariant.description: Buy the Bike Yoke Squeezy online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The dropper post on my MTB was getting severe stiction with the seatpost clamp that came with the bike, even at low torque settings and it wouldn't hold the post securely at those low torques either. The seat tube is just slightly out-of-round (but within tolerance). I read Bike Yoke's engineering explanation and it made sense to me. As Bike Yoke says, the clamp doesn't have a continuous metal collar around the top, instead it has three metal tabs to keep the clamp from sliding down the seat tube. They claim the design distributes the clamping force much more evenly than a standard clamp with a continuous collar. 

Sometimes these kinds of explanations are just hype, but I'm very pleased to say not in this case. It really worked! No more stiction on the dropper post and the Squeezy holds the post in the frame very securely. It really works very well for me. Bonus is, it weighs next to nothing. I bought a second one for my road bike. 

So why four stars not five? Because you have to be VERY careful using a good torque wrench and good technique to tighten down the clamp. This clamp really does seem to put a lot of force on the seat tube and seatpost at lower torques than other standard design clamps I've used -- I could feel that in my hands while twisting the torque wrench. I started at a low torque (well below the max), and increased it gradually as I tested the seatpost for security. I usually just stick a clamp on and tighten it to the max but not with this clamp. Additionally, some people have complained it didn't work well for them but it was because their seat tube or seatpost tolerances were not good enough. All in all, it's a great clamp but requires good frame and seatpost tolerances, and careful installation. Oh, and I love that it uses a Torx head screw and did I mention, it weighs next to nothing!
review.name: Super light and works great for droppers

name: Squeezy

review.name: Awesome Skort!

review.reviewBody: Great skort. Perfect length. Love the pockets. Very flattering.

review.reviewBody: I love this skort so much, I now have it in 3 different colors! it is great for active use-hiking, walking, camping-I haven't tried it for running, but i generally do not like running skirts. I find the fit just perfect-I got the small (I am 5'9" 138lbs). The material is breathable and wicking, and it is super cute for casual wear too!

review.reviewBody: Love the fit of this skort, the A line is super flattering. You can dress it up or wear it for exercise. Definitely recommend!

review.reviewBody: Took this on my recent trip to Spain and wore it so many times.  I’m petite so length was perfect.  Dries quickly after washing.  Zipper pocket on left side and inner pocket on shorts leg.  Ordering in more colors now!
review.name: Love this skort!

review.reviewBody:
I LOVE skorts in the summer for their comfort and versatility so was excited to spot this Backcountry one in a great shade of green.  I was puzzled that the specs said only "mid-thigh" for length instead of a measurement like standard for most every brand I own.  I took a gamble and was disappointed.  Skort was true to size (I always take a size S and it fit) and the "lines" of it are nice.  The inner pocket fits an oversized iPhone, which is great.  But, it's crazy short, which makes it only usable maybe for tennis -- definitely not around town.  The fabric feels too plastic-like and the color is more army-green than depicted online (not bad, just be aware.)  But, I would have kept it if it was really mid-thigh in length.  Compared to all my skorts from Athl*** which range from 14-16" in length and would be considered mid-thigh, this was was 12-13" depending on how it laid.  The lining shorts underneath are at least as long, which means that they extend past the skirt line on the scalloped sides -- which looks silly.  The angle of the photos here don't highlight it, but I can see that's the case on the similar Destination Dress.  
Thanks to Backcountry for the quick shipping, great customer service, and making it easy to return (even if I must pay for shipping.)
review.name: Super short skort

review.reviewBody: I will never get tired of athletic fitting skorts, they are so comfy and easy to wear. This one has a great fabric for running around doing a ton of activities but still looking cute 😊
review.name: Love skorts!

name: Destination Skort - Women's

description: Buy the Silca Sicuro Titanium Bottle Cage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sicuro Titanium Bottle Cage
hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Sicuro Titanium Bottle Cage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Great looking tubular titanium cages in a traditional shape, perfect for my classic Ti road bike.

They hold water bottles securely, but bottles are still easy to get in and out, no rattling. Titanium tubing does not mar or scratch water bottles.

The fit and finish is fantastic, the four tiny welds along the mounting  plate are perfect, as is the barely noticeable weld that closes the ends of the tubular titanium cage.

There’s also a wide vertical adjustment possible on the slotted mounting plate, I lowered the rear cage all the way, which makes it easier to get to taller water bottles.

Yes, they’re not cheap, but they should last forever, and Silca guarantees them for 25 years.

The only downside is that there were no included Ti bolts, which were included when Silca first introduced these cages, but are no longer included with the current “V2” design.  Silca makes their own Ti bolts for the cages, with a wider low profile head and a unique design, I just ordered those separately.
review.name: Perfect Ti Cages For A Ti Bike

name: Sicuro Titanium Bottle Cage

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket for skiing in lighter conditions as well as mountaineering

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 5'11" and 175lbs, I have a very long torso and lengthy arms. This jacket fits perfect in a Medium. Most jackets have good arm length but feel too short. I like the backs of jackets longer as well as the sleeves and this fit the bill. The waterproofness has been top notch and great for a shell. You can use this as a resort shell, everyday shell, or a ski touring shell. It feels solid and the 70D outer is strong but not loud and crinkly. Definitely recommend to anyone who needs an all purpose jacket.
review.name: Phenomenal Quality and Fit

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: High quality and well built. Have used this in wet snow and the waterproofing was great. Also used it on a windy cold day in the Colorado alpine, and it had good wind blocking, the pit zips are easy to use.. I'm happy with it so far, I got it for skiing, ice climbing and hiking and it will work good. Weight didn't seem too bad and it's got a nice heavy weight feel. I like the material, the outer is just a little soft and has nice feel. The hood is large, and im sure would fit a helmet.. A couple cons: arms are just slightly long, to fully cover gloves I think but are long for normal use. The zippers seem good but are a little smaller sized to use with gloves. For fit, I'm 5'9 about 170 and got the large. It's not an athletic fit and is slightly boxy, but I found it comfortable in the chest and waist and can still have a layer under it. I use a lighter thermal type jacket under it comfortably. A mid weight down could be worn but it's a little snug.
review.name: Solid shell

name: Taiss Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought the Scree last year and have used it for multiple local day hikes on the AT and other trails in Virginia.  I just returned from using it as my pack for my 6-day hike of the West Highland Way in Scotland.  It’s such a fantastic pack.  It’s tough, super adjustable and very comfortable.   Sometimes I miss the two exterior front pockets my Coulee 30 has, but I adjust my packing style accordingly.  I also used the Scree as a carry-on bag (overhead bin) on my flights.  It worked great for that too.  Love MR’s quality and features.  (Aside from the Scree and Coulee, I also have a Bridger 45.)
review.name: Fantastic pack!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for sprIng hiking in 2024.  Excited to use it, packed and unpacked the Scree 33 to practice for the upcoming hiking season.
review.name: Can’t wait to hike

review.reviewBody: Functional design with easy access to the whole bag with the 3 zipper design.  Very comfortable!
review.name: Great quality!

review.reviewBody: I love the way the bag opens. It makes organizing all my gear for a multi-day trip very easy.
review.name: Very convenient bag

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a medium hiking bag that can do some lighter overnights. This fit great, only wish there was some looping on the bottom to mount a sleeping system.
review.name: Great Value

review.reviewBody: I just replaced my sweet pea after 15 years. It wasn’t expired just old and ugly. I love the color and the streamline harness for women. I can’t wait for my next adventure.
review.name: Love the color

review.reviewBody: I got this pack for a week long trip to DC and Virginia. We flew in and spent the day in the city with all our luggage. I was looking for a carryon pack that would be comfortable to walk around with for a day in the city, big enough for a week long trip but smaller than my backpacking pack. This pack was perfect. It fit a large and med packing cube, toiletries, laptop, book, chacos, rain coat and water bottle perfectly. I had to pack pretty light but for a summer trip that was no problem. When we boarded the plane all the overhead bins were full and I was able to squeeze it under the seat in front of me. It stuck out quite a bit and I bet if a flight attendant had noticed it they would have made me put it overhead. The harness system was super comfortable and I was happy to be carrying it all day long. I am 5ft 5in, 150 lbs and I bought the M/L, the S/M probably would be better for me (straps are cinched almost all the way and the tails are very long) but I opted for the larger size so my boyfriend can also use it. I really liked the accesibility of the zipper design, and all the pockets are well placed. I cant wait to use this pack for future day hikes, overnights, and who knows!
review.name: Awesome Pack

review.reviewBody: Just bought my wife a scree 32 and it is awesome to say the least. Mystery Ranch makes the best packs out there.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: Bought for fiancé as a bday gift right before trip to GNP! She loved it. Perfect size and fit day hiking gear, water, food. Comfortable and sturdy back support and straps. She thought the waistband was comfortable as well. Elastic straps on the front were handy to secure trekking poles. I used an MR pack as well for the trip (Pinter with GL frame).  Both performed flawlessly over the course of 3 days and 40 miles. We will continue to buy MR packs in the future! Thanks MR.
review.name: Excellent day pack!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my daughter to use for mountain climbing. We climbed this past weekend on a 11 mile 6,000 vertical foot trip and it performed perfectly. Very comfortable pack that has the capacity for a wide-range of gear. Also has the ability to be used on various types of terrain from easy trail to off-trail trips. I think the women specific features make a big difference.
review.name: Great Climbing Pack

name: Scree 33L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Not good. Changed design from previous version. No expanding waist. Runs very small. Fabric now too thick.
Love these pants! Fashionable enough to wear to any nice dinner and very comfortable with how light they are. Dry super fast. I’ve gone from the river wet wading to dinner right after. Can’t beat it!
review.name: Best pants ever

review.reviewBody: The only thing that Simms makes that is actually true to size. As of late, everything I order has to be a small when 5 years ago I would have been a medium. But these pants are awesome and it feels like you're not even wearing them.
review.name: True to size

review.reviewBody: The new modifications on these pants for this season were great. Love the new draw string in the waist. And are a much better true size cut. Best light weight pants I have ever had. Perfect!
review.name: Great light weight pant

review.reviewBody: I’m a huge fan of Simms clothing and these pants are great.  They fit me well and are extremely comfortable.  I use them mostly for sun protection (as opposed to shorts) flats fishing and on the trout streams inn wet wading season.
review.name: I highly recommend these pants!

review.reviewBody: Perfect. I can't imagine a pair of pants fitting and feeling any better. Extremely lightweight, perfect for hot summer day or wet waiting
review.name: Outstanding

review.reviewBody:
Love these. Makes my wife happy I’m not wearing old man jeans 👖 Very comfortable !
Cheers
review.name: Pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband because he fishes in the river and kayaks and likes to be fully covered when out in the sun. He said they are lightweight and cool, he did not get overly warm while wearing them. The material is durable. He loves the extra features for fishing and they look great too. They did run small. He wears a 34” waist and I ordered that then when I compared them to his jeans, they were one size too small. So I returned and ordered the 36” and they were perfect. Highly recommend this product.
review.name: Perfect sun protection pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband because he fishes in the river and kayaks and likes to be fully covered when out in the sun. He said they are lightweight and cool, he did not get overly warm while wearing them. The material is durable. He loves the extra features for fishing and they look great too. They did run small. He wears a 34” waist and I ordered that then when I compared them to his jeans, they were one size too small. So I returned and ordered the 36” and they were perfect. Highly recommend this product.
review.name: Perfect sun perfection pants

review.reviewBody: Pants are really light and comfy. I feel like they run a little small. Would like to see snap buttons instead of button and loop. The draw strings are nice so no use of a belt is nice.

name: Superlight Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: It's been a long time since I bought a climbing helmet. Major improvements, this helmet is great. Rock fall and side impact protection!
review.name: Modern Helmets!

review.reviewBody: Good in between for the vapor and a traditional hardshell. As someone with a small head, I think this looks better on me than the vapor and other BD helmets.

review.reviewBody: The vision helmet is sooooo comfortable and light. I hardly know I'm even wearing it.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great helmet. Its light and comfortable and easily adjustable to fit a beanie under when it’s cold.
review.name: Light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Light. Comfortable. Thankfully, I haven’t had to test it with any impact events!
review.name: Light. Comfortable. Thankfully, I haven’t

review.reviewBody: Loving the lightweight nature of the helmet. Durability remains to be seen as it certainly will get tested over time, but so far so good. My one only issue, and it' something I'm mostly used to now, is that the design of the straps makes it impossible to change the alignment and position of the clips around your jawline. I have a normal head (my friends might disagree) so it fits fine, I just wish I could make small tweaks to the location. Still, I would buy this again no question.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: Adjustment mechanism sticks a bit but super comfortable.
review.name: Adjustment mechanism sticks a bit

review.reviewBody: Great helmet. Light and comfortable. Only problem was the pad glue did not hold the padding in. Easy fix
review.name: Great helmet. Light and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Great, lightweight helmet. Cant even tell it’s there
review.name: Great, lightweight helmet. Cant even

review.reviewBody: This helmet might be heavier then the Vapor and less durable then the half dome but it strikes the perfect blend of those two helmets, light enough that you’ll wear it durable enough that you’ll be able to wear it for years. Best helmet I’ve worn, sometimes I’ll forget it’s even on.
review.name: All rounder helmet
