review.reviewBody: they fit really well, and are more durable than the older version of the tc pros. There is more cushion in the tongue and the rubber covers the big knuckle more.
review.name: good for cracks and edging on granite

review.reviewBody: There seem to be two different versions of newer TC Pros, there are even two variants available at Backcountry right now, at two different prices. I believe the more expensive are the usual ones, and these fit differently. They are larger, more aggressive, heels are different, and overall not as good as the old ones. You can see at the picture I attach that their photos look different. Disappointing.
review.name: Two versions of TC pros?

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, good fit. They're amazing in more ways then one. Wohoo!
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I can now understand why these are so popular for big MO climbs. Comfortable enough and great shoes. I bought a second pair so I have a reserve pair when I resole them. My street size is US 7 / 38 and I bought these in 39 since LS always runs smaller for me and the fit is great.
review.name: My outdoor MP shoes

review.reviewBody: Offers solid protection. Fit is on par with my other la sportiva shoes
review.name: Great crack shoe

review.reviewBody: Received a defective pair from Backcountry. The left and right shoes have significant differences between them, and the pair is significantly larger than my last pair of TC pros of the same size. This last pair was the updated model as well. This should be a warranty issue but ultimately I am not going to pay to ship my shoes back after I already paid to have them shipped here. Quality control at Sportiva is clearly way down because this is beyond the subtle differences of leather stock used. Went and tried the same size on today at REI and they fit much better and were more similar to the last pair. The issue in my pair seems to stem from the heel being assembled poorly, there is almost no heel cup in this pair, my last pair had a much snugger fitting heel. Normally the heel flattens as shoes beat in as well since the slingshot is meant to stretch, these are already near vertical. Couldn't be more disappointed seeing as this is my 4th pair of TC pros and I am not really sure what I am going to do with them.
review.name: Defective product can't return

review.reviewBody: I have owned a pair of TC pros (same model) at 40.5. They fit really tight and snug, with no room at all at the toe. They were perfect. So I figured if it isn’t broken don’t fix it, so I ordered the same shoes in the same size. These shoes are loose and baggy compared to my other ones, and the heel cups have much less tension through the Achilles. They are comfortable, but also are very inconsistently sized compared with my old ones. Very disappointed. I love these shoes but unfortunately can’t trust sizing. Last time I buy shoes, even ones I thought I knew well, online without trying them on.
review.name: Sizing was off (label was right)

review.reviewBody: La Sportiva must have changed the sizing in between the pair I’ve got, first pair was 41.5 so I ordered the same size and now there’s dead space in toes and heel. Held the new shoes against the old just to make sure I wasn’t crazy and there’s over a 1/4 inch difference.
review.name: Whack

review.reviewBody:
While i cannot speak to the changes since version 1, which a lot of climbers complain about, i have enjoyed these so far. Hayden was right, these are crampons for granite! They stick to whatever you set your foot on and the stiffness in the toebox/toe takes all the strain off your toes. 

PROS:
- Sticky Rubber
- Stiff Flat Toebox 
- Mid-top protects ankles in cracks
- Tommy's name on the box :)
- smearing granite and stepping on tiny dimples never felt so good. 
-p3 heels are my favorite 

CONs: 
- Why is there a tongue that is easily folded over? i have to carefully put these on concentrating not to fold the tongue over. the tongue should be a full side to side to prevent this. being on a hanging belay trying to correctly put these on because the tongue is so easily bunched up (which would create pressure points is outrageous and i have no idea how testers did not complain about this. 
- Apparently the build quality is not as good as before but i've only put like 300m on these so far so i can't speak to that either. they're holding up okay. 
- For me, a person with wider feet, these feel a bit narrower than the skwarmas (42 in skwarmas are much wider than 43 in TCs). i blame tommy for having narrow feet.
review.name: Crampons for Granite

review.reviewBody: I think performance wise, sportiva has this shoe pretty dialed. does everything people hype it up to. with that being said, the tongue on this model has consistently given me issues. the tongue feel not quite wide enough, so the edges roll pretty bad the closer to the toe, which makes sock less wearing pretty uncomfy. aside from that, this shoe is all it is cracked up to be.. literally
review.name: what u expect

name: TC Pro Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I purchased the XL believing they were good quality. I was surprised when my wife told me at the beach the first time I wore them that they were 95% see through. Incredibly disappointing because they are comfortable.
review.name: Completely See Through When Wet

review.reviewBody: These are really well made with a great fit. Wearing them all summer for all activities.The only complaint is limited colors. I would more if they had in Navy, Black, Red, etc.

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts, but better make sure you wear something under them. As soon as they get wet you can see more than you planned to show the public.
review.name: See through

review.reviewBody: I have one pair of these shorts. They are my favorite shorts. I'd like to buy more, but I need a better color selection. I love the back pocket which your shorts with better selection dont have
review.name: Better color selction needed

review.reviewBody: Was really excited about these but when I got out of pool these were see through. Disappointed because I really liked the look of these other than that.
review.name: Fit and look great but when I get them wet see through

review.reviewBody: My mom bought these trunks for my dad. He loved the fit and feel of the shorts. “I would rate them a 4/5 stars for fit and feel.” HOWEVER, I could not find a single rating, review, blogpost OR Reddit thread that actually said how long the “fast drying” would take. My thorough research assured me the sun was not a necessary element for the fast drying capabilities of this suit. Thus, our experiment began. After soaking the suit in the ocean with gallons of water he stood straight in the shade for 45 minutes at which point I declared “fast” was over. After 45 minutes he’s not dry, the suit did not cling to him during his 45 minutes of drying which is a plus. At approximately the 35 minute mark water droplets ceased to fly off when pinched. Overall, after 45 minutes he was heavily damp.
review.name: 3.5 stars for varied results

review.reviewBody: Got them for my husband for Father’s Day and he loves them. Got the large and they fit great. He is 6’0” and about 175lbs for reference. Love the color!
review.name: Awesome swim trunks!

name: Andros Trunk - Men's

hasVariant.name: XTR BL-M9100 Disc Brake
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XTR BL-M9100 Disc Brake online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These breaks are super light and look great. I was building a bike with weight in mind so I went with these XTR brakes. To keep with the weight theme I bought Magura rotors. After I installed them I did a simple bleed at the levers and hit the trail. The braking power was terrible. The bike I built was super fast but I was so nervous with these brakes. I bought them because I wanted the Shimano bite feel but these felt like SRAM breaks! I tried upgrading the the rear rotor from 160 to 180 but it didn't make a difference. Tried a full bleed with no luck. Next I tried removing the pads and making sure there was no sheen and ruffed them up. Tried a proper full bleed and then bed in with no luck. My last move was to buy new composite pads and that did the trick! Way better and finally feel like Shimano breaks! Can't understand how such expensive brakes could come with what seemed to me like garbage pads. They look amazing, are really light and finally perform!
review.name: Super high end but garbage pads!

name: XTR BL-M9100 Disc Brake

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these pants. I think they are great. I use them all winter on mountain treks. Very comfortable and when it gets colder, I just layer with my merino wool underneath.  I'm 5-7" and weigh 160#. And the mediums fit great.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: Marketed for running, but I will likely use for bike, soccer, paragliding.  Narrow zippered cuffs are hard to find, and the front-only protection from wind and water is unusual.  A selection of inseam lengths is great. My only concern is the calves are snug on me and my calves are not unusual.
review.name: More than just for running

review.reviewBody: Pants are nicely lightweight and weatherproof, but could use a drawstring and be offered in a long inseam. The fit is ok on me, but not great. However, I'm 6'4" 200lbs and right between a large and xl. These pants will likely be fine for men 6'1 and below, but make sure you pick the waist size from the sizing chart that meets your actual waist measurement. The lack of a drawstring is unfortunate. In my opinion, they are also quite overpriced, so carrying a little buyer's remorse. I will use them, but they aren't my go-to running/riding pants.
review.name: Not a perfect fit for me, but may work well for others.

review.reviewBody: Predominantly a cold weather running pant, though I have used it for nordic skiing as well. I find the pant performs exactly as I hoped, meaning that I can run in above freezing temperatures without overheating, but don't freeze at -10C. Excellent fit, trim but not tight, great freedom of movement.
review.name: Brilliant product and design

review.reviewBody: In my proper size, the waist and length are perfect. However as another review mentioned, these are tight in the crotch. Since I need these for ultra trail running, I need to be comfortable so this will not do. I will size up and try that, but I fear the waist will be too baggy and the pants will fall when I run - especially because there is no drawstring in the waist. Perhaps these will work for people with a very lean build, but for someone with a slight muscular build in the thighs I find these way to tight in the crotch.
review.name: Tight in the crotch and thighs

review.reviewBody: Very pleased. I'm shorter/stockier (5'5"/170lbs) and the medium was great for me (32" waist), although they fit a bit snugger than shown in the taller model on the website. VERY warm pants. I would have liked regular pockets as well, but the two side leg pockets work great for phone/keys. Great for shoveling snow or running and everything in-between!
review.name: Great winter running pants!

review.reviewBody: Hey they actually keep the wind/cold air out and have moderate breathability. Works as advertised. Elastic band fits me well although there is no draw string.
review.name: Wind blocking

review.reviewBody: Overall, they are a great pant. The material is awesome and they look very nice. I'm 6' and 168# and the M fit well. That said, the fit is slightly off in the crotch area. It's not terrible but it does distract from earning the 5th star.
review.name: Impressive Pant, fit slightly off

review.reviewBody: I've used these pants a few times now and really like them for days running around or below the freezing mark. They are comfortable and provide a good range of motion, and the wind proof fronts really make a difference. I am six foot and 180 pounds, 32 inch waist and went with the medium, it fits well but a large might have given room to put a layer underneath for really cold days.
review.name: Great Cold Weather Pant

review.reviewBody: These pants are awesome. I got them for winter running as I needed something to offer mild warmth but really cut wind. They do both exceedingly well. The insulation in the key areas keeps warm while still retaining optimal breathability. They are not waterproof, but they're not meant to be as breathability is the key here. I really like the tapered/athletic fit and they stay in place very well. The only drawback is the lack of a drawstring. It would make someone in between sizes have a difficult time getting them to work. However, the waist is elastic and has so far worked well enough. The insulation in the key areas keeps warm while still retaining optimal breathability.
review.name: Great Wind Pant

review.reviewBody: I’m an experienced MTBer and have now ridden with these shoes for 3 months. I was drawn to this model as a lighter alternative, but with that comes a shoe that is simply not comfortable on the foot. It’s certainly stiff and will adequately do the job, but there are much better options at a slight cost in weight. In addition, the BOA closer wire cut through the plastic sleeve it’s encased in and now jams up and is very difficult to use - this after about 4-5 rides. I’ll take it up with Backcountry and Fi’zi:k, but my suspicion is that I’m going to be out $179. Don’t waste your money on these - as a fellow rider put it, you too will be disappointed if you do.
review.name: Look elsewhere

review.reviewBody: This is, basically, a good shoe. However, the insole/footbed is awful.  My feet would start screaming after 20 miles.  A pair of Specialized body geometry footbeds mostly solved the problem. I expected better from Fizik.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody:
I've been riding mtb for about 25 years now and have tried many shoes so I've got a good base to which I can compare.   The only caveat is that I've only had these shoes a short while but have already put almost 30 hours on them.  Most of my rides are between 2 and 3 hours so I'm in the shoe long enough to tease out any "issues" the shoe may have with fit.  

They check all the boxes for a great mtb shoe.   

Fit.  They fit my foot great.   Snug where it needs to be but still leaves room for the toes.  The lace system allows you to snug the shoe down perfectly.  No slop.   No heel lift.  I think they run a bit large.   I'm usually a 44 or 45 but needed to go with a 43 on these.  I do have a relatively "low volume" foot.   I don't think the fore foot is narrow in this shoe.  Other brands I can say are narrower.   These are certainly not narrow in the toe either, unlike many other brands.   The instep an heel area is probably on the "snugger" side.   For me that is good.   That is where I want a solid fit.   It prevents heel lift and slop in the shoe under hard pedaling and pulling.   For the reviews that mention lack of mobility of the shoe's tongue...   The tongue is held in place by small velcro-like tabs that attach to the inside of the shoe's instep area.

No mesh.  Love it.   Many of us ride in the cold and damp.  Mesh shoes let water in but not out.  In the hot summer, let's face it, your feet will be warm - mesh or no mesh.   Let's ditch the mesh on more mtb shoes.

Supportive sole but still ok for hike a bike sections.   Near perfect balance I'd say.   The grip is excellent and has held up well.   The stuff I ride is techie and at times requires hike a bike sections.   Even includes dancing on rocks on stream crossings.  I might put a slightly thicker insole in but not sure about that yet.

Simple.   Minimal seams to leak, break down, or tear.   This is my first shoe with a Boa and I hope it holds up.   All black.   No silly color schemes.

Light weight.   Probably the lightest mtb shoe I've owned.

I have other good mtb shoes in the rotation and they have their niche uses.   But now these own the top spot.   I like them so much I'll likely buy a backup pair.

I could give a comparison to quite a few other shoes I have owned or currently own but will simply say, thus far these are my favorite.   The others include shoes from Sidi, Specialized, Giro, and Five Ten.
review.name: Great shoe.  Best I've owned.

review.reviewBody:
As one other person said these shoes fit a bit narrow, this seems to be a trend for Fizik as I have another pair of their shoes that fits about the same. 

At first I thought the choice of a single boa was great as I really don't like the combo shoes where it's part boa part velcro but it doesn't actually work out that great. I find that it's hard to get the right pressure/tightness along my whole foot with only a single point of adjustment, I usually have to pull the boa straps out and feed them around a bit so that when it tightens it does so in the right places.

The ventilation is good and the build quality is fantastic, as you'd expect from Fizik, despite the above comments I love these shoes and continue to wear them all the time for gravel and even mountain biking.
review.name: Narrow & Boa

review.reviewBody:
If you know your Fizik fit then this shoe will fit similarly. I have a 280 mm length foot with width varying at around 110 mm so slightly wide and the 46 fits comparable to my street shoe of 11.5.

If you have narrower feet you probably could size according to their chart. If your feet run slightly on the wider side then you will want to go with your "euro" street shoe size.

These shoes have a good forefoot platform with a lot of room for the toes to stretch and the nice heel fit typical of other Fiziks and while the single Boa seems somewhat limiting it was easy enough to get a good fit right out of the box.

The sole isn't quite as stiff as a pure carbon sole so this might be better as a training/rec. level shoe. If you're looking for maximum stiffness this probably won't cut it for you but for an everyday shoe that's easy to put on, take off, and keep clean this seems like a winner.
review.name: Good Fizik Fit

name: Vento X3 Overcurve Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I am a male 5 feet 10 inches tall, 195 pounds, 36 inch waist. I ordered an XL and it is very tight. I am going to keep it, but if ordered again, I would order an XXL!
Also very thin, can almost see through it but will be good for very warm weather or could even wear under cargo shorts when mountain biking. Nice chamois but would not buy again.
review.name: runs very small

review.reviewBody: Great shorts. Rode 30 miles this morning and fit like a glove. Am 5' 8" and 170 lbs. Mediums work fine but if you are bigger than me, better order large. Padding is good as well.
review.name: My favorites so far

review.reviewBody: I'm relatively new to cycling community, bought my first gravel bike in April.  I've been riding a few times a week on my bike and needed a short that was comfortable for both long and short rides.  I usually average about 15 miles per ride, have gone as far as 40 miles on a ride.  These shorts are fantastic, the fit is really nice and comfortable and the chamois is really comfortable as well.  I have a stockier build and thicker legs and the Medium is a nice fit.  They dry incredibly fast and the grippers at the bottom of the short really hug your legs, but not too tight to rip your leg hair off.  So far its been warm weather here in CO on my rides in the mid 70s to high 80s, and these breathe really well and don't get super hot.  I would definitely buy these again, great short for someone who isn't racing competitively.  Good price point for someone not looking to break the bank on shorts or bibs but still wants higher quality than some of the other companies out there.  I will continue to buy Castelli cycling clothing for sure.
review.name: Great short for avid enthusiast

review.reviewBody: I wouldn’t wear this again for sun protection. I never left the house without this on and still got a bad sunburn on my upper back. I was outside and in the water for ~6 hours. I’m so shocked. I wear these instead of sunscreen to protect reefs and be extra safe from skin cancer but it’s not effective.
review.name: Got burned

review.reviewBody: I have this in Black L and XL, and change up the size depending on the activity I'm looking to do. It's very easy to zip up, i LOVE the top down/bottom up dual zipper (for those of us with hips that don't lie), and the zippered pockets are a very nice touch. For the price point, this is a steal of a deal. Fabric is nice and light-weight, and it has a little sheen to the fabric, but nothing too "much." For me, the sleeves are too long on me, but most sleeves are and they're easy to push/roll up and they stay. I think it's a little unnecessary to have a huge "carve designs" logo on the end of the sleeve, because with this piece in particular, I'd probably wear it out to dinner as a coverup if it weren't for that. But certainly recommend for those looking to get stylish, comfortable sun protection and not have to slather on the sunscreen every two hours! Thank you, Carve Designs, for being so thoughtful and conscientious with your manufacturing, quality and styles.
review.name: Versatile piece, lovely weight to fabric

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love everything about this. Quality, fit, lightweight. It's going snorkeling in Indonesia
review.name: Perfection found!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really love the quality and versatility of this. Plan on wearing as a layer for travel to Hawaii and using it as a rash guard for snorkeling and other water sports. I got a size medium which is the size I usually am these days in tops. Fits well but not form fitting. I think if I’d gone down in size it wouldn’t been too small, so I’m happy with the fit.
review.name: Comfortable and high quality

review.reviewBody: Technically these zip front sun shirts are great! Lightweight, cool and comfortable with pockets large enough for a phone. Would like to see in rich new colors, like emerald green, aqua, coral etc. Contrasting color on the zipper and/or cuffs and collar would be nice as well as darker vertical side panels for a slimming effect.
review.name: Very comfortable and functional!

review.reviewBody: This is my second lake Sun shirt and it's so nice. It's winter here in Colorado but I wore it this weekend as a post gym cool down layer. I bought the bouquet color and it's gorgeous. I really like it for water sports and for hiking in the summer time.
review.name: This is my second lake

review.reviewBody: Love it! I am going on a cruise for the first time and will need this for the excursions. I have owned one for 8 years now and the only reason I needed a new one is because I have out grown it, LOL! So I can’t wait to use this one - I trust I will have no problems and will look amazing :)
review.name: Love it!!

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'9", 140 lbs, chest 35", waist 29", hips 40.5" (my shoulders are slightly wider than most). I ordered medium, and it fit - fitted through the shoulders and top, but not affecting my movement. Stomach isn't super tight across, so it won't cling or pull on me or a wet swimsuit. The neck with the higher zip is nice to offer more sun protection. The side zip pockets are a nice feature - my Samsung Ultra (which is a large phone) will zip in it because the material is stretchy. My aunt has one that she has loved. I look forward to using it, mainly to protect my skin from the sun.
review.name: True to Size, good sun protection & features.

review.reviewBody: Such a cute shirt to wear over anything on a nice day. The fit is a little snug on me for an XL but I am very, very top heavy so that can be a me problem. The pattern is so pretty and the light weight is really nice.
review.name: Beautiful lightweight shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love Carve clothing. Fit, Quality & design are great & I love the fact that 2 women started the company. I also like that the clothing is made from recyclable products. I only wish you guys wouldn’t run out of sizes so fast!
review.name: I love Carve clothing. Fit,

review.reviewBody: This jacket has Leo me warm from 60-35 degrees! I love its pack ability and it was my #1 go to jacket for a recent Peru trip. Recommend 1000%!
review.name: The absolute best

review.reviewBody: I really love this jacket! It’s incredibly light, and warm. Perfect for backpacking and traveling.
review.name: Warm and light!

review.reviewBody: Runs a full size big. I measured as a medium, which was huge. Small is perfect and roomy.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: This is lighter than a hoodie mid layer and I can wear it either as an outer layer when it’s warm or as a mid layer when it’s cold. It packs down to nothing.
review.name: My New Everything Jacket

review.reviewBody: I love the feel and fit of this jacket! The only flaw is that the inside zippered pocket lies above the collar line of the shirts I wear underneath, so it rubbed against my skin and was annoying.
review.name: So close to perfect!

review.reviewBody: The ratio of lightness to warmth on this jacket is insane! I love the design and fabric. I wish you did a perfectly black one too though. I also bought the Xenair vest to combine with the jacket for incredible warmth. The vest in size 12 and the jacket in a size 14 for a looser fit that allows layering. The sizing around the body & bust is spot on with these jackets, (I’m a 34DD for reference), whilst the difference in length between a 12 and a 14 in body and arms is a tad too much for me. But it’s ok, because the elasticised hem allows to fit the jacket higher up the hips. All in all, thank you for amazing quality Rab. You have a new customer for sure.
review.name: The ratio of lightness to

review.reviewBody: I just love this jacket. It is so light and yet so warm. I wear mine for cycling. On its own it is perfect, and in the rain, I wear a RAB shell on top. Last week I spent two hours at a demo and though the temp was only about 6 degrees, I was toasty warm. I already have a RAB Electron down jacket, but it gets sweaty on a bike, and it is such a hassle to get it cleaned. I am planning to visit Lapland early next year and discovered my Xenair jacket will easily fit under the Electron one, so I am all set! Beautiful Jade green colour too. I am smitten.
review.name: Best washable jacket ever

review.reviewBody: I also have the Xenair Alpine jacket but I use this 'light' version when trail running. Like the Xenair Alpine, I find the 'light' version provides a comfortable fit without restricting movement. For me, it is the perfect jacket when trail running and travelling light is important (more so than when I go hiking). While it unsurprisingly provides less warmth than the Xenair Alpine, that's not a problem when I'm running - out it comes during descends or on the flat and away it goes (easily) into it's left pocket when not needed.
review.name: Great high intensity activity jacket

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket, nice colour, lovely fit and great quality
review.name: Love this jacket, nice colour,

review.reviewBody: Amazing jacket so light but yet so warm and the colour ultramarine is beautiful but expected it to be more blue than green so colour not exactly as in pictures
review.name: Amazing jacket so light but

name: Xenair Alpine Light Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Tech Drive High-Volume Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
On an empty tire it works great.
At 10psi it gets tough to use.
At 20psi it took all my strength to work the pump.
I tapped out at about 25psi.  No where near enough to be useful for inflating tires on the road.  90psi stated has to be aspirational for the World's Strongest Man competition.
I used my floor pump to check the pressures alternating with this pump as I tested it before mounting it on the bike.    
I'm probably average strength for athletically oriented middle-aged men.
review.name: Have to be VERY strong to use it

name: Tech Drive High-Volume Pump
